author: imaginethat
title: Israel's "red line?"
text: Posts: 40,803 Israel's "red line?" Doesn't seem like the Zionists are leaving much wiggle room here. The Zionists have never held back in striking Hezbollah. Now, Hezbollah is part of the Russian coalition of the willing.... Quote: Defense Minister: We're not coordinating Syria response with Russia In the wake of Putin's statements that he is 'worried' about Israeli retaliatory strike, Ya'alon says defending borders is Israel's sole prerogative. Israel is not coordinating our Syria response with Russia, Defense Minister Moshe Ya'alon said Tuesday in the wake of Russian President Vladimir Putin's statements that he was "worried" about recent Israeli strikes in Syria. ..."The prime minister made it clear to President Putin that we are not getting involved in the debate of who will be in power, Assad or someone else," Ya'alon said during a tour of Gaza border communities. We have our interests, and when they are threatened we act and will continue to act," continued Ya'alon. "This was made clear to the Russian president, and this is the result: During the holiday (Sukkot) we acted, and will to continue to act, against any violation of or damage to the interests I mentioned.""We will hit anyone who tries to violate our sovereignty, anyone who tries to transfer advanced weapons systems to terror organizations, especially Hezbollah, and anyone who tries to transfer chemical weapons to terror organizations and Hezbollah," he said. We have our interests, and when they are threatened we act and will continue to act," continued Ya'alon. "This was made clear to the Russian president, and this is the result: During the holiday (Sukkot) we acted, and will to continue to act, against any violation of or damage to the interests I mentioned.""We will hit anyone who tries to violate our sovereignty, anyone who tries to transfer advanced weapons systems to terror organizations, especially Hezbollah, and anyone who tries to transfer chemical weapons to terror organizations and Hezbollah," he said.
